cause.description:
Local charity started in 1992 in Porth, Mid Glamorgan, South Wales.
Volunteer helpers humanely trap and spay feral cats, and injured cats/dogs. We rehome as many as possible but sadly most people will not take adult cats, and want kittens. In those cases the volunteers add to their own expanding cat families!
Fosterers, adopters and financial support always needed. Cheques by post to :-
Mrs C Weeks 13 Pencoed Ave Pontypridd Mid Glamorgan Wales CF37 4AN
Adoptions and fostering call :-
Mrs P Anthony 01443 683882
Donate online www.rvaw.co.uk
UK Registered charity (1998) 1072131 Details can be viewed on Charities Commission website.
1. TO RELIEVE THE SUFFERING AND DISTRESS OF ANIMALS WITHIN THE RHONDDA AREA AND TO PROMOTE THEIR WELFARE AND WELLBEING AT ALL TIMES B) TO EDUCATE AND TO INFORM THE PUBLIC AS TO THE CORRECT CARE AND TREATMENT OF THEIR ANIMALS
